name: crisprseq-pooled-screening
title: CRISPR Pooled Screening Analysis
description: Analyzes pooled CRISPR knockout, activation, and interference screens to identify gene function. Supports targeted sequencing for editing validation (KO/KI/base/prime editing) and screening experiments with multiple statistical methods. Samplesheet format: `sample,fastq_1,fastq_2`
content:
CRISPRseq - CRISPR Pooled Screening Analysis

Comprehensive bioinformatics pipeline for analyzing CRISPR-edited genomic data from both targeted sequencing validation and large-scale screening experiments. Supports gene knockouts, knock-ins, base editing, prime editing, and functional screens (CRISPRko/a/i).

What is CRISPRseq?

CRISPRseq enables systematic analysis of CRISPR experiments from validating single edits to genome-wide screens, identifying essential genes, synthetic lethal interactions, and gene function through comprehensive statistical analysis.

Key Features

  • Dual Analysis Modes: Targeted sequencing and screening
  • Multiple CRISPR Types: KO, KI, base, prime editing support
  • Screen Types: Knockout, activation (CRISPRa), interference (CRISPRi)
  • UMI Support: Molecular barcode processing
  • Multiple Statistical Methods: MAGeCK, BAGEL2, DrugZ
  • CNV Correction: Optional copy number adjustment

Targeted Sequencing Workflow

  1. Read Processing: Merge paired-end reads, quality control
  2. Adapter Trimming: Remove adapters and quality filter
  3. Optional UMI Clustering: Consensus sequence generation
  4. Read Mapping: minimap2, bwa, or bowtie2 alignment
  5. Edit Calling: Parse CIGAR strings for variant detection
  6. Visualization: Edit efficiency and outcome plots

Screening Workflow

  1. Read Processing: Quality control and preprocessing
  2. sgRNA Quantification: Count guide sequences
  3. Optional CNV Correction: Adjust for copy number
  4. Statistical Analysis: MAGeCK, BAGEL2, or DrugZ ranking
  5. sgRNA/Gene Ranking: Identify hits and candidates
  6. Optional Hit Selection: Filter significant targets
  7. Visualization: Volcano plots, rank distributions

Scientific Applications

  • Functional Genomics: Gene essentiality screens
  • Drug Target Discovery: Identify therapeutic targets
  • Synthetic Lethality: Find genetic interactions
  • Gene Editing Validation: Verify editing outcomes
  • Resistance Mechanisms: Identify resistance genes

Supported CRISPR Methods

  • Knockout (KO): Gene disruption screens
  • Knock-in (KI): Precise integration validation
  • Base Editing: Point mutation analysis
  • Prime Editing: Complex edit assessment
  • CRISPRa: Activation screens
  • CRISPRi: Interference screens

Advantages

  • Comprehensive: Handles all CRISPR experiment types
  • Multiple Tools: Best-in-class algorithms integrated
  • Quality Control: Extensive QC metrics
  • Reproducible: Containerized workflow
  • Well-Documented: Detailed usage guides

Input Requirements

  • FASTQ Files: Sequencing reads
  • sgRNA Library: Guide sequence reference
  • Sample Sheet: Experimental design
  • Optional: UMI patterns, CNV data

Main Outputs

  • Gene Rankings: Scored target genes
  • sgRNA Counts: Quantified guide abundances
  • Statistical Results: p-values and FDR
  • Edit Analysis: Insertion/deletion profiles
  • Visualization: Plots and summaries
  • QC Reports: MultiQC quality metrics

Perfect for: CRISPR Screens • Gene Function • Drug Discovery • Synthetic Lethality • Genome Editing
